info.headline: Flood Warning issued April 4 at 9:31PM CDT by NWS Louisville KY
info.description:
...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Indiana... Kentucky...
Ohio River at Tell City affecting Perry and Hancock Counties.
Ohio River at McAlpine Upper affecting Floyd, Jefferson, Clark and Oldham Counties.
Ohio River at Cannelton Lock and Dam affecting Crawford, Hancock, Perry and Breckinridge Counties.
Ohio River at McAlpine Lower affecting Clark, Meade, Hardin, Jefferson, Floyd and Harrison Counties.
Ohio River at Clifty Creek affecting Jefferson and Trimble Counties.
.Heavy rain from the past few days will cause the river to rise.
* WHAT...Moderate flooding is forecast.
* WHERE...Ohio River at McAlpine Lower.
* WHEN...From Saturday afternoon until further notice.
* IMPACTS...At 65.0 feet, Parts of US 31W (Dixie Highway) flood from I-265 (Gene Synder Freeway) interchange to West Point KY. Riverfront parks in Clarksville and New Albany flood. At 66.0 feet, Lock is closed. Floodgates at Riverport are closed. At 67.0 feet, Blackiston Mill Road floods at Silver Creek in Clarksville.
* ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 10:00 PM EDT Friday the stage was 48.4 feet. - Bankfull stage is 45.0 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise above flood stage early tomorrow afternoon and continue rising to a crest of 68.0 feet early Tuesday afternoon. - Flood stage is 55.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 68.0 feet on 04/18/1948. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction:
Turn around, don't drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
Caution is urged when walking near riverbanks.
Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.
Additional information is available at www.weather.gov/lmk.
The next statement will be issued by Saturday afternoon at 100 PM CDT /200 PM EDT/.

parameter.value: FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM SATURDAY AFTERNOON UNTIL FURTHER NOTICE

area.areaDesc: Clark, IN; Floyd, IN; Harrison, IN; Hardin, KY; Jefferson, KY; Meade, KY
